c74object.name: the.mc.bzmap~
c74object.digest: Provide and manage a Signal-driven named Busymap
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Allows for dynamically managing Busymaps of MC-Objects based on values in a global Buffer using the same name, or by means of an incoming Multichannel-Signal.

objarg.name: number-of-channels
objarg.digest: Specify a maximum number of voices
objarg.description: Specify a maximum number of voices. These can be muted or toggled into busy state for mc-objects using the bzname attribute with this named busymap. Their initial number of channels defines how many of the busymap channels these objects can use.

objarg.name: busymapname
objarg.digest: Provide the name for this global busymap
objarg.description: Provide the name for this global busymap. This name is also used for the buffer which it reads its busymap from. This buffer's values can be modified externally to manage busymaps dynamically.

attribute.name: map
attribute.digest: List of nonzero values activates voices
attribute.description: List of nonzero values activates respective voices. Shorter lists than the total number of channels is allowed, but unaddressed voices will be ignored.

attribute.name: voice
attribute.description: Toggle specific voices. A list consisting of index (zero-based) and value will toggle the respective voice. Several pairs can be toggled using one list command.

attribute.name: mute
attribute.digest: Toggle the mute flag for entire busymap
attribute.description: Toggle the mute flag for entire busymap. When set to '1' all voices will be muted, when set to '0' all voices will be activated regardless of previous map.

attribute.name: threshold
attribute.description: Specify an activation threshold. The default is 0 (any non-zero value will activate voices). Any normalised float value (0.-1.) will only activate voices if its value exceed the given threshold.

attribute.name: manual
attribute.description: Set voice activation mode. The default is 0 (buffer-based). When set to '1' any incoming multichannelsignal will handle activation of voices in the busymap and the buffer contents will be ignored.

attribute.name: cpumonitor
attribute.description: Set CPU-Monitoring interval (ms). The default is 0 (no CPU-Monitoring). Higher integer values specify time (in ms) between successive CPU-usage queries; the current CPU-usage is sent out the right outlet (0-100).

method.name: bang
method.description: Manual CPU-usage query. The current CPU-usage will be sent out the right outlet (0-100).

method.name: map
method.digest: List of nonzero values activates voices
method.description: List of nonzero values activates voices

method.name: mute
method.digest: Toggle the mute flag for entire busymap
method.description: Toggle the mute flag for entire busymap

method.name: multichannelsignal
method.description: Set busymap manually when the manual flag is set to '1', otherwise the internal buffer handles the busymap.
